data.title: Top 50+ Popular Companies that Donate to Nonprofit Organizations
data.meta_description: Amazon, Starbucks, Chevron, Microsoft, and Google are just a few companies that donate millions to nonprofits. Learn more about the top charitable businesses!
data.text:
Every Bank of America employee is eligible to request up to $5,000 per year in matching gift funds to nearly any organization.

Bank of America’s matching gift program will match donations made to nonprofit organizations up until March 31st of the following year. That means that your organization has plenty of time to make a last-minute end-of-year appeal or start-of-year appeal to remind your donor base to submit match requests.

Bank of America Charitable Foundation offers several funding opportunities to nonprofit organizations.

They direct their funding to meet the needs of low- and moderate-income communities, with a particular focus on revitalizing neighborhoods, educating the workforce, and addressing basic needs like hunger and homelessness.

Bank of America employees also help their communities through volunteerism and connect nonprofits and communities to much-needed resources.

Since 1954, GE has been known as one of the top companies that donates to nonprofits.

While GE initially only matched employee donations to colleges and universities, the company has expanded its match program to include nearly all nonprofits.

In early 2024, GE split into 3 companies: GE Aerospace, GE HealthCare, and GE Vernova. All have matching gift opportunities.

While GE Aerospace and GE Vernova employees can have donations ranging from $1 to $5,000 matched, GE Healthcare employees can have donations from $25 to $10,000 matched.

The GE Foundation is the philanthropic arm of General Electric and focuses its efforts on workplace diversity, global health, humanitarian relief, education, and local volunteerism.

The GE Foundation does not encourage unsolicited grant proposals.

However, organizations whose mission aligns with the goals of the GE Foundation may be selected by the Foundation to receive a grant.

Google matches up to $10,000 in donations per employee each year.

One of the highlights of Google’s match program is that the company not only matches personal donations to nonprofit organizations, but also matches money employees personally raise for charitable events that they actively participate in, such as walks, marathons, or bike rides.

Google.org is one of the ways that Google gives back to local, national, and global communities.

Each year, Google.org donates $100,000,000 in grants, 80,000 volunteer hours, and $1 billion in products.

They provide funding to support global entrepreneurs in underrepresented communities, organizations using technology for societal and environmental change, equitable access to education, and community grants.

Through the Google Ad Grants program, Google supplies eligible nonprofits with $10,000 in free funding to use on its paid advertising platform. Since 2003, Google has given over $10 billion worth of free advertising to over 115,000 nonprofits in 51 different countries.

Applicants undergo an eligibility check and application process. Once they’re approved, they can create ads that target the search terms their prospects are searching for online. Best of all, the grant automatically renews each month!

A lot goes into routine account maintenance, so many organizations turn to an expert Google Grant manager to create their ads and monitor performance.

General Mills matches donations ranging from $25 to $1,000.

Full-time and part-time employees are eligible to have their gifts matched at up to a 2:1 ratio.

General Mills donates to educational institutions, arts and cultural organizations, civic and community organizations, environmental organizations, health and human service-based organizations, and more.

Best Buy brings technology to teens and gives back to the communities in which they do business. They’re in the process of reaching their goal of opening 100 Teen Tech Centers by 2025, which teach teens how to leverage new technology and prepare them for future careers in tech.

Best Buy is also committed to advancing human rights and practicing sustainability.

By revenue, BP, a London-based oil and gas company, is the fifth largest company in the world, and they share their wealth accordingly. BP will match donations raised through fundraising up to $5,000 per employee per year.

Their matching gift program and volunteer grant maximums are also $5,000. Through the Fabric of America Fund, BP even allows employees to request up to $300 for their nonprofit of choice without donating or volunteering. BP employees can submit requests for this grant while on the company intranet.

The BP Foundation is a charitable organization that helps communities around the world by supporting STEM education, economic development, practical approaches to environmental issues, veteran programs, and humanitarian relief.

The foundation has also committed to supporting economic and environmental recovery in the Gulf of Mexico following the Deepwater Horizon oil spill in 2010.

CollectMore is State Street’s matching gift program for fundraising. Through CollectMore, State Street will match their employees’ fulfilled pledges up to $10,000 annually.

CollectMore is part of a three-pronged program for financial giving, which also includes GiveMore, their matching gift program, and DoMore, their volunteer grant program.

Through GiveMore, employees can get up to $10,000 in donations matched per year, senior VPs are eligible for $20,000, executive VPs are eligible for $30,000, and board members, CEO, president, and vice chairs are eligible for up to $40,000. State Street’s DoMore program allows employees to request a $500 grant for every 16 hours they volunteer with a nonprofit.

The State Street Foundation is dedicated to supporting nonprofits through sizeable grants each year. These grants often focus on education, college success and credentials, and employability.

Most notably, the State Street Foundation has invested over $3.6 million in Early College, a program in which high school students take college classes and explore potential career paths.

They also offer a charitable board matching program, which provides training for State Street employees interested in serving on nonprofit boards.

Intuit’s fundraising match program will double the funds that an employee personally raises for a fundraising activity such as a walking, running, or cycling event. There’s a combined maximum indvidual and fundraising match of $5,000 per employee per year.

The company matches fundraising dollars that are raised in support of most nonprofits, including educational institutions, health and human services, arts and cultural organizations, civic and community organizations, and environmental organizations.

Through Chevron’s Humankind Volunteer Grant Program, the company provides funding to nonprofits where employees and retirees volunteer on a regular basis.

There are two tiers for individuals who volunteer regularly:

20 volunteer hours = $500 grant

40 volunteer hours = $1,000 grant

Volunteers can submit their volunteer grant requests until January 31st of the following year.

Chevron is committed to promoting sustainability, whether that’s through more traditional environmental protection efforts or by supporting diversity, economic development, education, health, and human rights. They aim to contribute to the UN Sustainable Development Goals in order to create a more sustainable world by the year 2030.

Through its volunteer program, Chevron helps people across the globe who need access to water, food, and opportunity. They also host Chevron Volunteer Week each year so Chevron employees can volunteer at nonprofits in Richmond and the Bay Area.

Disney VoluntEARS encourages employees to volunteer in their communities and rewards these efforts with grants to the eligible nonprofit of their choice. The grant amount varies according to total time volunteered:

10-24 hours = $100 grant

25-49 hours = $250 grant

50-74 hours = $500 grant

75-149 hours = $1,000 grant

150+ hours = $2,000 grant

Disney also offers $2,500 grants through their “VoluntEARS of the Year” awards, which recognize exceptional individual volunteers.

Disney is committed to strengthening communities by providing hope, happiness, and comfort to kids and families who need it most.

Through their charitable giving programs, Disney brings positive, lasting change to communities around the world.

In 2022, Disney gave about $233 million to nonprofits that help children and families.

They focus on supporting children’s hospitals, arts and STEM education, and environmental conservation.

Through Starbucks’ Giving Match Program, Starbucks provides grants to nonprofits where U.S. and Canadian employees and retirees volunteer.

Starbucks employees are eligible after volunteering for at least 25 hours with an organization. They can then request a $5 grant for each volunteer hour tracked for up to $1000 total.

Starbucks also has a matching gift component of their Giving Match Program, in which employees can have their donations of $25 to $1,000 matched.

Through its corporate philanthropy program, Starbucks offers opportunities for veterans, college students, farming communities, and more.

Additionally, the Starbucks Foundation, a separate 501(c)(3) organization, grants money to nonprofits devoted to workplace diversity, sustainability, and disaster relief.

Starbucks also, and not surprisingly, supports coffee, tea, and cocoa communities around the world. Through Starbucks Foundation Origin Grants, Starbucks supports women in coffee and tea-origin communities by promoting women’s leadership, providing economic opportunities, and expanding access to clean water. This program mainly helps women and girls in communities across Africa, Asia, and Latin America.

Coinstar allows you to convert coins into cash, eGift Cards, cryptocurrency, or charitable donations. They have a volunteer grant program for their employees that will donate up to $600 per employee based on the number of hours volunteered:

10 hours = $150 grant

20 hours = $300 grant

30 hours = $450 grant

40 hours = $600 grant

Employees must volunteer for at least 10 hours and can register their requests electronically.

Coinstar offers its full-time and part-time employees a generous matching gift program.

Donations ranging from $50 to $5,000 are eligible to be matched at a 1:1 ratio.

Most nonprofits are eligible to receive a matching donation, and employees can request matching funds until January 31st of the year following the donation date.

CVS Health employees can apply for Individual Volunteer Challenge Grants, which reward up to 100 hours of volunteering with up to $1,500 according to the following tiers:

15-25 hours = $500 grant

25-100 hours = $1,000 grant

100+ hours = $1,500 grant

CVS Health also offers Team Volunteer Challenge Grants. Teams of five or more who volunteer for more than 50 combined hours can apply for a team volunteer grant of up to $2,500.

There is also a team fundraising match option where CVS Health will match a team’s walk, run, or ride fundraising efforts. They will match up to $5,000 raised or donated per team with a minimum of $500 raised or donated by the team.

Through the Kohl’s Volunteer Program, Kohl’s provides grants to nonprofits when employees volunteer.

Kohl’s donates $25 per volunteer hour with a minimum time commitment of one hour.

Since the inception of the Kohl’s Volunteer Program in 2001, they’ve donated over $184 million, thanks to the over 5.5 million hours volunteered by their associates over the years.

Kohl’s aids communities in need by partnering with:

Alliance For A Healthier Generation

Boys & Girls Clubs of America

NAMI

Nonprofits in the greater Milwaukee area

They also offer the Kohl’s Cares program, which sells select children’s books and toys and contributes 100% of the net profit to kids and families in need. Lastly, Kohl’s A Community with Heart program allows Kohl’s employees to nominate local nonprofits for a grant from Kohl’s.

Through the Verizon Volunteer Incentive Program, Verizon provides grants for nonprofits their employees volunteer with. To be eligible, employees must volunteer at least 50 hours in a calendar year, and in return, the nonprofits they volunteer with can receive $750 from Verizon.

Employees can request a total of $1,500 in volunteer grants per calendar year and must record their volunteer hours in the Employee Engagement Incentive Program portal.

The Verizon Foundation is the philanthropic arm of Verizon. They’re dedicated to solving critical social issues in the areas of digital inclusion, climate protection, and human prosperity.

Grant applications are by invitation only. Nonprofits are encouraged to contact their local community relations manager to see if they are eligible to apply.

CarMax offers volunteer grants of $15 per hour volunteered for a minimum of eight hours. Individuals can earn up to $5,000 in combined matching gift and volunteer grant donations per year for their cause of choice.

Dependents of employees up to the age of 26 are also eligible to participate in the volunteer grant program.

CarMax also encourages CarMax employees to volunteer together through their Volunteer Team-Builders program. For example, employees can earn $500 from CarMax for their cause of choice by hosting a donation drive or volunteering in a group of 5-24 employees.

CarMax offers a matching gift program to full-time, part-time, and retired employees.

Employees can have their donations to most nonprofits matched at a 1:1 ratio.

The minimum amount that CarMax will match is $25, and they will double donations up to $5,000.

IBM matches the donations that its employees make to nonprofits. They will match a donation as small as $25 and go up to $10,000.

They will match donations at a 1:1 ratio for U.S.-based colleges, universities, and other post-secondary institutions, Pre-K and K-12 schools, hospitals, hospices, and nursing homes, and cultural and environmental institutions.

Microsoft facilitates year-round employee philanthropy, but they make an annual push in the month of October.

Microsoft’s campus plays host to more than 200 activities during October, including a 5K run, an online auction, and other special events. In 2022, Microsoft employees raised $255 million for over 32,000 nonprofits.

Microsoft offers nonprofits world-class productivity, platform, and cloud technology to help them do even more good in their communities.

They are also committed to supporting humanitarian relief and disaster management as well as working toward technologies and policies that are accessible to everyone.

In August, Teradata promotes its Annual Days of Caring. During this campaign, the company encourages employees to give back to nonprofit organizations of their choosing.

The company will set up recurring payroll deductions and match employee donations, but only during this specific period of time.

Teradata Cares is a program designed to build strong and vibrant communities, improve quality of life, and make a positive difference where their employees live.

Teradata offers scholarships, community service grants, an environmental conservation program, monthly volunteer awards, and a program that allows employees to help each other in times of crisis.

During IMF’s annual giving campaign, they will match employee donations to most nonprofits.

Employees and retirees can donate directly through payroll deduction or make a one-time payment. The campaign then matches donations at a 1:1 ratio with a maximum of $5,000 per employee.

The campaign begins in October and goes until the end of the calendar year.

The International Monetary Fund has a philanthropic program called Giving Together. Giving Together is dedicated to raising money for disaster relief, organizing staff volunteering, and awarding charitable grants.

IMF gives grants to organizations that focus on providing people with educational and economic opportunities. The average grant is $15,000, and nonprofits can request these grants through IMF’s website.

American Airlines believes that good corporate citizenship contributes to the economic and social well-being of its employees, shareholders, customers, and their communities.

They dedicate their corporate philanthropy to nonprofits that help children, communities, and military service members.

Through in-kind contributions, volunteerism, and monetary donations, American Airlines supports nonprofit organizations that work to make a difference in their communities.

Delta employees regularly donate their time and money to worthwhile causes and organizations.

Delta employees also spend time teaching students financial literacy, entrepreneurship, and economics.

Delta Airlines and its employees give back to the communities in which they live and work by partnering with organizations such as the American Cancer Society, the American Red Cross, the Breast Cancer Research Foundation, the Children’s Miracle Network of Hospitals, and Habitat for Humanity.

United Airlines offers cash support to eligible nonprofits on a limited basis.

To qualify, organizations in the U.S. must be registered with the IRS as a 501(c)(3) organization, must be inclusive of people of all demographics, and must follow United’s additional guidelines.

Then, nonprofits must apply online and include specific information surrounding the event or project for which they are requesting donations.

JetBlue For Good focuses on areas of social impact that are most important to its customers and crewmembers, including youth education, environment, and community organizations.

Additionally, the JetBlue Foundation partners with nearly 100 nonprofits and education institutions to advance STEM and aviation education for women and people of color.

Through their Dollars for Doers program, Alaska Airlines and Horizon Air offer employees a volunteer grant program that awards up to $1,000 to a nonprofit each year.

After employees volunteer at least 5 hours with an organization, the company will provide a volunteer grant of $10 per hour to that nonprofit.

The Dormie Network Foundation supports nonprofits in their fundraising and donor stewardship efforts through their in-kind donation program. Nonprofits can request consideration to receive a donation of a Dormie Network membership, which they can auction off for fundraising revenue or give to loyal donors as a token of appreciation. These high-end memberships can be worth thousands of dollars, making this a lucrative fundraising opportunity.

The Dormie Network Foundation has donated millions of dollars worth of in-kind memberships to nonprofits that fall within four focus areas:

Youth Golf

Environmental Initiatives

Military & First Responders

Healthcare & Humanitarian

The Dormie Network Foundation has supported more than 2,500 organizations within these verticals, such as the Make-a-Wish Foundation and Sisters Across America.

Hilton’s Travel with Purpose program has played an important role in bringing their vision to life by uniting their organization around issues such as youth opportunity, environmental stewardship, and community resiliency.

The program provides a framework for global goals and solutions while supporting their teams to achieve local impact.

InterContinental Hotels Group, which is composed of InterContinental Hotels and Resorts, Holiday Inn, Crowne Plaza Hotels and Resorts, Hotel Indigo, Staybridge Suites, Even Hotels, and others, works with charitable organizations whose focus is on environmental sustainability, local economic opportunities, or disaster relief.

InterContinental Hotels Group also helps individuals build their own careers through the IHG Academy, giving local people skills training and education.

Each September, InterContinental hosts their annual Giving for Good Month campaign. During the campaign, employees are encouraged to volunteer and make an impact on their local communities.

In 2022, Giving for Good Month focused on employability, food insecurity, and sustainability. For example, employees in Atlanta came together to pack 500 meal boxes for local children in partnership with Goodr.

Universal extends its support throughout Central Florida to make positive changes for a better place to live. Their inspiration is today’s youth and the future of a diverse universe.

They focus their efforts on empowering youth to be extraordinary and being a caring community partner.

Host Hotels and Resorts offers a matching gift program to its full-time and part-time employees.

Donations between up to $500 are eligible to be matched at a 1:1 ratio.

Host Hotels matches donations to most nonprofits that have a presence in communities where Host Hotel employees live.

Choice Hotels’ matching gift program matches current full-time and part-time employees’ donations to most nonprofits.

Donations ranging from $25 to $1,500 are eligible to be matched at a 1:1 ratio.

The program is only available for corporate employees, but associates of franchises should check with their individual hotels to see if a similar program is offered.

The Home Depot will match employee donations up to $3,000.

Full-time and part-time employees are eligible to have their contributions matched at a 1:1 ratio.

The Home Depot will match up to $1,000 annually per employee to each organization they donate to, with a maximum of three charities per employee.

The Home Depot Foundation pledges to improve the homes and lives of U.S. veterans and their families.

Their grants allow their nonprofit partners to purchase materials and supplies for community volunteer projects.

In addition, Team Depot, their associate-led volunteer force, is making a difference for veterans and those in need of disaster relief in the communities where their associates live and work.

State Farm will match donations ranging from $25 to $4,500.

Full-time employees are eligible to have their donations matched at a 1:1 ratio.

State Farm matches donations to schools and universities, safety organizations, and community development nonprofits in the U.S. and Canada. Donors have a year from the date of the donation to submit a request.

Through Target’s corporate giving program, the company gives support for disaster relief and local families in need.

Their Community Engagement Funds allow employees to support local programs and organizations that help families in need. These grants are by invitation only.

Target also allows nonprofits, schools, and government agencies to request a Target GiftCard donation in stores. The average donation is $25-50 with a maximum of $500 per year for each organization.

Through Walmart’s Volunteerism Always Pays (VAP) program, the company offers grants for nonprofits where their employees volunteer. For every hour volunteered, Walmart provides a volunteer grant of $10 with a maximum of $1,000.

The company also offers team volunteer grants to groups of Walmart employees who volunteer or participate in fundraising runs together.

Walmart requires that volunteer activities are sponsored and planned by the nonprofit hosting them.

Walmart consistently donates more than $1.7 billion annually worldwide. The eight areas they support through their grant program include:

Community and economic development

Diversity and inclusion

Education

Environmental sustainability

Health and human service

Hunger relief and healthy eating

Public safety

Quality of life

Their community grant program accepts applications on a quarterly basis starting February 1st and ending December 31st.

Grant awards range from $250 to $5,000. Organizations must operate on the local level to be eligible.

The James Cash Penney Award Volunteer Grants honors current and retired employees who volunteer at nonprofits.

Grant amounts vary depending on the time spent volunteering, but employees can request anywhere from $50 to $500 to go toward the nonprofit they volunteer with.

Employees must volunteer for a minimum of 15 hours before they are eligible to apply for a volunteer grant.

The JCPenney Communities Foundation is an affiliated nonprofit entity that is committed to supporting American working families by providing job readiness opportunities, nutritious food, and access to education.

They partner with organizations such as Feeding America and Alliance for a Healthier Generation and allow customers to lend their support through Round Up donations.

Office Depot supports a variety of charitable initiatives through its community investment program. One area of focus is providing school supplies for students in need through the Start Proud program.

The company also hosts a Season of Service campaign during the holiday season to support nonprofits with volunteer and philanthropic projects. In the spring, they have a Depot Day of Service that encourages employees and their families and friends to volunteer in their local communities.

Office Depot’s Elevate Together program powered by Round It Up America works to address systemic discrimination in business growth and profitability that impact the Black and Hispanic communities.

Office Depot has partnered with the National Urban League’s Entrepreneurship Centers and the U.S. Hispanic Chamber of Commerce to support Black and Hispanic-owned small businesses with five or fewer employees. They provide cash grants and in-kind donations, as well as technical assistance, mentoring, and access to professional networks and platforms.

Dick’s Sporting Goods offers donations and sponsorships to youth sports teams and leagues. They support organizations that have a focus on sports, as well as organizations that promote physical activity for young people.

Dick’s Sporting Goods has an easy-to-use online donation request process, so make sure to fill out your donation application in advance.

To celebrate Dick’s Sporting Goods’ 75th anniversary, The Dick’s Sporting Goods Foundation will contribute a $75,000 grant to 75 youth sports organizations in the U.S.

Since 2014, their Sports Matter Program has donated $80 million to support youth athletes and sports programs. They invest in these programs to improve sports infrastructure, reduce registration fees, lower league costs, and distribute proper equipment to all.

Gap matches part- and full-time employees’ donations, as well as those of retirees.

Contributions ranging from $10 to $15,000 are eligible to be matched to most nonprofits at a 1:1 ratio. Gap will match up to $1,000 for part-time employees and up to $15,000 for full-time employees.

Match requests must be made within 120 days of the original donation date.

For every 15 hours a Gap employee volunteers with a nonprofit in a calendar year, the company will provide a $150 grant to the organization.

For every 25 hours a store team of three or more employees volunteers with a nonprofit that serves youth or women, Gap gives a $250 grant to that organization.

Grants of $1,000 to $10,000 are provided to nonprofits where Gap employees sit on the board.

Macy’s matches donations to most nonprofits that full- and part-time employees and retirees make.

Donors who give $25 to $500 are eligible to have their donation matched at a 1:1 ratio.

Matching gift submissions must be sent within one year of the donation date.

Employees must be at the company for 12 months in order to be eligible.

Nordstrom offers a matching gift program to its full-time and part-time employees.

Donations ranging from $10 to $5,000 are eligible to be matched at a 1:1 ratio.

Employees must have worked with Nordstrom for at least one year before they are eligible to apply for a matching gift.

Albertsons offers community giving cards that nonprofits can sell to raise money for their cause. Organizations can sell preloaded cards at face value that their supporters can use at Albertsons or Safeway.

Then, the nonprofit earns up to 5% of what its supporters spend every four weeks. Supporters can even reload their cards to keep giving back to their favorite charitable organizations.

The Albertsons Companies Foundation offers grants to nonprofits dealing with hunger relief. While food insecurity is their national priority, each region has its own priorities that nonprofits can investigate to determine if their work aligns.

Grant amounts vary by region.

The foundation recommends including an employee sponsor to strengthen your grant application. They typically respond to requests six weeks after the end of the application cycle.

The Coca-Cola Company matches donations of up to $10,000 per year per employee or retiree to most nonprofits.

The minimum donation amount is $25, and contributions are matched at a 2:1 ratio. Coca-Cola will contribute up to $20,000 per employee or retiree each year.

Matching gift requests must be completed and returned to Coca-Cola by February 28th of the year following the initial donation.

Kroger customers can help support nonprofits of their choice by enrolling in Kroger Community Rewards. When members use their Shopper’s Cards, they earn rewards for their organization.

Kroger also uses Kroger Community Rewards to help make organizational fundraising easy by using their Shopper’s Card. Every time members of an organization use their Shopper’s Card, they will earn a rebate. Kroger pays up to $600,000 annually to organizations using the Kroger Community Rewards program; an individual rebate maximum is $24,000 per organization.

Kroger’s Zero Hunger | Zero Waste program donates food to local food banks and donates money to help food banks broaden their services.

The Kroger family of stores is committed to helping families put fresh, wholesome food on their tables.

Kroger partners with Feeding America, No Kid Hungry, the USO, and American Red Cross to ensure that American families don’t go hungry.

The Whole Planet Foundation works to alleviate poverty in the countries where Whole Foods sources its products. Whole Foods has donated over $37 million to the cause since it began in 2005.

Whole Foods also has the Whole Kids Foundation, whose mission is to support schools and help families improve their children’s nutrition. Their KidsGardening Program teaches kids about gardening and the importance of fresh food.

Lastly, Whole Foods also operates the Whole Cities Foundation, which strives to provide nutritious food to underserved communities.

Publix matches full-time employees’ donations to public or accredited private schools, colleges, or universities.

Donations ranging from $25 to $5,000 are eligible to be matched at a 1:1 ratio.

Employees have to have worked at Publix for at least one year before they are eligible to apply for a matching gift.

Each Fresh Market store has a quarterly budget for in-kind donations. These stores engage in a variety of creative fundraising efforts and partnerships with local nonprofits, providing them with gift cards, food trays, gift baskets, bottled water, and more.

Nonprofits can submit a donation request with their local store for fundraising events, walks/runs, and other community programs.

The Fresh Market partners with Feeding America to help fight food insecurity. The Fresh Market stores each donate food to Feeding America’s partner food banks and agencies multiple times per week.

During the month of September, The Fresh Market celebrates Hunger Action Month by working with Feeding America to raise money through their Round Up fundraiser. The Fresh Market customers can choose to round up their total purchase amount to donate to Feeding America.
